page.title: 14FYLDE TRANSPORT FACILITIES.
page.content: Approximately 80 buses serve Lytham per day.These are a mixture of Fylde Ribble and Blackpool Borough Transport Some routes are; lla, l93,l67, 22a, llc. All bus routes stop in Lytham Square. There is no planned link between bus and rail services. The revolutionary railbus has saved the closure of Lytham and St. Annes rail lines. When the railbus enters service in May l986 a new Blackpool South-Ormskirk line is also to be introduced.This service will operate the latest bus-trains.The rail buses are designed for a "Hop on Hop off"service.The trains run from Blackpool South to Kirkham;26 through Lytham each day.The station is now delapidated and unmanned.Plans have been made for the station to be converted into a new shopping centre /restaurant keeping Victorian style.
